title: The computer was born to solve problems that did not exist before.
details: I'm a computer science PhD student at Berkeley, where I am advised by Sanjam Garg.
Previously, I graduated from IIT Bombay with a Bachelor's + Master's in Engineering Physics.
I worked as a research intern at Cloudflare, I worked on post-quantum solutions for Privacy-Pass and more generally, Post-quantum Anonymous Credentials.

title: Appreciate your hardwork and strive for better
details: Hi and welcome! I'm a PhD student in computer science at Berkeley, advised by Sanjam Garg and Umesh Vazirani. I am also supported by an NDSEG fellowship. The focus of my research is designing cryptographic schemes for quantum computers that provide distinctly quantum forms of security.

As an undergrad at Princeton (class of 2019), I studied electrical engineering with a minor in applied math. Mark Zhandry helped me find my footing in computer science and served as my primary research advisor.

title: Computer science empowers students to create the world of tomorrow.
details: I am a computer science PhD student in the theory group at Berkeley, where I am advised by Sanjam Garg . My research focuses on various aspects of cryptography, including secure computation, program obfuscation, and quantum cryptography.
Previously, I completed a BSE and MSE at Princeton, where I was advised by Mark Zhandry ..
